critique: The document is an approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Hotel Industry by President Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1933, under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It reflects a strong interventionist approach by the federal government in the economy during the Great Depression. The code aims to establish fair competition, suggesting a move towards regulated economic activity. The document also highlights the executive power exercised by the President in approving and modifying the code. There is no direct mention of immigration, security, or social inclusion. The emphasis is on federal control and economic regulation.
